statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Bryon Russell was strong enough to give the Utah Jazz a lift. Russell, in his third game back, scored a season-high 19 points and played tough defense on Paul Pierce as Utah beat Boston.
article.headline: Russell scores season-high 19 in victory
article.linkText: Recovering Russell helps Jazz sink hot Celts
article.story:
SALT LAKE CITY (AP) -- Bryon Russell was strong enough to give the Utah Jazz a lift.
Russell

Russell, in his third game back after recovering from a pelvic injury, scored a season-high 19 points and played tough defense on Paul Pierce as Utah beat the Boston Celtics 99-86 Wednesday night. "I'm sore and I'm not 100 percent, but I think I played well and we played well collectively off the bench," said Russell, who helped the Jazz reserves outscore the Celtics' backups 43-19. "It's nice to see Bryon get back into it," said Karl Malone, who had 17 points. "B-Russ, I love his confidence. He's been like that since I've known him and he's not afraid to take a shot." Russell scored just 15 total points in his first two games after coming off the injured list, but played his best game of the season as the Jazz (14-15) edged closer to reaching the .500 mark for the first time this season. "They had three people guarding Karl and they dared us to shoot the outside shot. I'm the wrong person to dare," Russell said. Donyell Marshall added 17 points, 10 rebounds and a career-high nine assists as the Jazz outscored the Celtics 46-20 in the paint and never let their lead drop below six in the final period. "We took advantage of what they gave us tonight and didn't collapse like we did in Boston," said guard John Crotty, referring to Utah's 98-92 loss in Boston five days ago. "We haven't been playing well, but kept our poise tonight and fought through the tough moments," Russell said. Utah has won 12 of its last 13 games at home against Boston and kept the Celtics (16-9) from sweeping the season series for the first time since 1987-88. Paul Pierce, who didn't take a shot until midway through the second quarter, led the Celtics with 28 points, but had just one point in the final 6:50 as Utah pulled away. "We tried to take the ball out of Pierce's hands, and even though some other guys were scoring, it kind of threw them off," Crotty said. Antoine Walker, who had 19 points, made a driving layup with 1:24 to play to get Boston to 93-86, but Malone had four points in the final minute as the Jazz scored the game's final six points. "They were more desperate for the win. Their backs are against the wall and they played hard," Pierce said. Malone was frustrated and shot just 2-of-10 through three quarters as the Celtics double-teamed the post. But Malone got going with two medium range jumpers to start the fourth period. Five days ago in Boston, Pierce and Walker combined for 55 points and Kenny Anderson scored a season-high 18 as the Celtics beat the Jazz. Boston had won six of seven and 12 of its last 14. "We came into a tough arena against a tough-minded, well-coached team that we beat last week. They are certainly not a sub-.500 team," Boston coach Jim O'Brien said. Erick Strickland's third 3-pointer in a three-minute stretch gave the Celtics their last lead of the game, 63-62 with 2:48 left in the third quarter. Sparked by five straight points by Russell, the Jazz reeled off 14 consecutive points midway through the second half. Anderson snapped the string with a jumper but John Crotty responded with a 3-pointer and Utah took the largest lead of the game, 79-65 with 10:08 remaining in the game. Game notes
Strickland went chest-to-chest with Malone after the Mailman floored him on a backcourt screen with 45 seconds left in the game. No call was made but Walker drew a technical foul arguing the play. ... The game began a four-game, five-day trip for the Celtics, who won four in a row on a road trip earlier this month.
